title: CSS for Kicks
excerpt: Practical CSS patterns I reach for first.

blocks.html: Because defaults matter. Small, reusable patterns remove friction and make teams faster.
Start with a single container and gap everywhere. Grid for macro, flex for micro.

items: Use rem for scale, em for local tweaks.
Pick 1–2 radii and 1 shadow scale site-wide.

blocks.html: Clamp early. Keep line-length near 60–75ch for body copy.

blocks.text: Make the right thing easy; the wrong thing hard.

blocks.html: One base, 2 variants. No custom colors per page.
That’s the kit. Small, consistent, boring—in the best way.

title: Debug logs that matter
excerpt: Logs should explain decisions, not just events.

blocks.html: Write logs that capture why, the key inputs, and the resulting outcome. Anything else is noise.

items: Include identifiers and counts (not entire payloads).
Add timing and status; link to traces.

blocks.caption: A tidy, structured log with useful fields.
